newsitem.title: UK: GKN still to appeal U.S. Meineke judgement.
newsitem.headline: GKN still to appeal U.S. Meineke judgement.

text.p: British engineering giant GKN Plc said on Friday it has filed notice of appeal against a U.S. court judgement, even though the damages awarded against its Meineke Discount Muffler Shops have been reduced.
The U.S. district court in Charlotte, North Carolina, reduced the amount of damages against GKN to $390 million (240 million stg) from $600 million previously.
The appeal process is expected to take around 18 months. GKN said in a statement that it has "very strong substantive and procedural grounds for appeal".

In March, a federal judge in Charlotte -- the headquarters of Meineke -- tripled compensatory damages of $197 million awarded in December by a jury that found Meineke committed breach of contract, negligence and fraud. That made it the largest commercial damages ever awarded against a British company in U.S. courts.
GKN said the reduced figure confirms the previous ruling and is within the 270 million pounds provision made by the company in its 1996 accounts to cover the judgement, interests and costs.

The damages had been won by Meineke's 2,500 U.S. franchises, who alleged that the auto-muffler retailer had mishandled and misappropriated millions of dollars charged to the franchisees for advertising.
